cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to accelerate NNE toward Florida’s Big Bend, make landfall, then track northeast across south-central Georgia and South Carolina, passing very near the Port of Charleston Friday evening before moving offshore of the North Carolina coast Saturday and continuing toward the Mid-Atlantic/New England offshore waters.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend between Suwannee River and Mexico Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland, FL to South Santee River, SC (includes Charleston area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Suwannee River to Destin FL (TS) and Suwannee River to Mexico Beach FL (Hurricane)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, coastal Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, and Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–50 mph sustained with higher gusts) possible Friday afternoon–night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible along the lower South Carolina coast including Charleston Harbor during high tide Friday–early Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts could cause flash flooding in the Charleston area Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out Friday; elevated seas and breakers will disrupt vessel movements and port operations.
